alert.note: Alert for Mora (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 24 at 12:39AM MDT until July 24 at 3:45AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Mora County in northeastern New Mexico... * Until 345 AM MDT. * At 1239 AM MDT, Emergency management reported flooding and debris flows into the Mora River near Holman due to earlier rainfall on the Hermits Peak-Calf Canyon wildfire burn scar. Flash flooding will impact areas draining into the Mora River near Holman, Cleveland and Mora. The debris flow can consist of water, ash, soot, rock, mud, burned vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding and debris flows from earlier rainfall. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Debris flows or rapid torrents of water, rocks, ash, soot and burned timber will be capable of carving a destructive path down the Mora River near Holman and southeastward. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mora, Cleveland, Holman, La Cueva and Golondrinas. This includes the following highways... State Road 518 between Mile Markers 22 and 44. State Road 283 near Mile Marker 13. State Road 94 near Mile Marker 18. State Road 434 between Mile Markers 0 and 4. State Road 121 between Mile Markers 0 and 3. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Runoff from rainfall will cause elevated water levels within vulnerable drainages in and downstream of the Hermits Peak wildfire burn area. Do not camp along streams and rivers. Remain alert when hiking in steep, narrow canyons. Know where you are relative to low spots and drainages.
